conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into.
The image shows five baffles labeled A, B, and C. There are two containers labeled D and E.
The liquid will flow from the baffles (A, B, and C) and enter either container D or E.
The baffles are designed to guide the flow of the liquid in a specific direction.
Baffle A is pointing towards container D.
Baffle B is pointing towards container E.
Baffle C is pointing towards container E.

premise: Since baffle A is pointing towards container D, the liquid from A will flow into container D.
conclusion: The liquid from A will flow into container D.

premise: Baffle B is pointing towards container E, so the liquid from B will flow into container E.
conclusion: The liquid from B will flow into container E.

premise: Baffle C is also pointing towards container E, so the liquid from C will flow into container E.
conclusion: The liquid from C will flow into container E.

premise: The liquid from A will flow into container D. The liquid from B and C will flow into container E.
conclusion: Liquid from A will flow into container D. Liquid from B and C will flow into container E.
